videos.videoTitle: OSI Model Explained
videos.description: Learn computer network layers or OSI layers in a computer network, OSI Model, OSI reference model or open system interconnection model or networking model including Application Layer, Presentation Layer, Session Layer, Transport Layer, Network Layer, Data Link Layer and Physical layer. Definition, Function, and use of the OSI network model. Protocols in computer network layers of OSI model.

videos.videoTitle: What is Firewall
videos.description: Learn different types of firewall, types of firewall software, types of hardware firewall, different types of firewalls, types of firewalls, types firewall, types of firewalls in network security, different types of hardware firewalls, types of firewall, different types of firewall, firewall configuration types, firewall types, 7 types of firewall, types of firewall in network security, types of firewall with diagram, firewall and types of firewall, types of network firewalls, firewall and its types, what is firewall and types of firewall, types of firewall architecture, types of firewall in networking, different types of firewall in network security, what is firewall and write the types of firewall, types of firewall attacks, firewall and types, firewall types and configuration, different types of firewalls and their functions.

videos.videoTitle: Network Devices
videos.description: Basic introduction to network devices

videos.videoTitle: MPLS - Multiprotocol Label Switching (2.5 layer protocol)
videos.description: MPLS can create end-to-end paths that act like circuit-switched connections, but deliver layer 3 IP packet. As we know, routing is the layer 3 function while switching is the layer 2 function. MPLs makes those routers on the Internet act like switches on a local network. That is why MPLS is also called 2.5 layer protocol.

videos.videoTitle: Circuit Switching vs Packet Switching | Circuit Switched Network vs Packet switched network
videos.description: Difference of network switching techniques involving circuit switching and packet switching in circuit switched networks and packet switched networks are explained with examples.

videos.videoTitle: IDS vs IPS vs Firewall
videos.description: This video describes the difference between Firewall vs IDS vs IPS in detail.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.1 - Course Introduction
videos.description: In this video, we go over the course overview, learning outcomes and machine learning resources that we will use in this class.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.2 - Introduction to Machine Learning
videos.description: In this video, we make an introduction to Machine Learning (ML). We learn machine learning lifecycle that gives us a high level view of some important ML processes and cover some useful ML keywords.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.3 - ML Applications
videos.description: We give some ML application examples in this video. We go over ranking, recommendation, classification, regression, clustering and anomaly detection applications and see some examples

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.4 - Supervised and Unsupervised Learning
videos.description: In this video, we learn supervised and unsupervised learning. We then see more details on supervised learning with regression and classification example problems and also have an example for unsupervised learning.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.5 - Class Imbalance
videos.description: We look at the class imbalance problem in this video and go over some methods to fix it.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.6 - Missing Values
videos.description: In this video, we go over missing values topic which is a common issue in machine learning problems. We learn to solve this problem by dropping records or by using some imputation methods.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.7 - Model Evaluation
videos.description: In this video, we learn model evaluation metrics, dataset splitting and overfitting-underfitting cases. For model evaluation, we consider regression and classification specific metrics. We then explain the dataset splitting process that allows us to get training, validation and test sets. We also talk about how to find out whether our ML models might be underfitting or overfitting.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.8 - Introduction to NLP
videos.description: We make introduction to NLP and learn these NLP terms: Corpus, Token and Feature vector in this video.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.9 - Machine Learning and Text
videos.description: In this video, we learn a simple pipeline to process text information. Machine learning models need well defined numerical data. Our pipeline takes text data and applies pre-processing operations on it. Then, it converts it into numerical representation with the vectorization step. After that, we can use a simple machine learning model on the data.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.10 - Text Preprocessing
videos.description: We give more details about text pre-processing in this video. We learn tokenization, stop words removal and stemming-lemmatization methods. These methods will clean-up and normalize our text data.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.11 - Text Vectorization
videos.description: In this video, we learn how to convert text data into numerical representation using Bag of Words method. This is an easy method that uses word counts/frequencies and gets numerical features from text data. We go over word counts, Term Frequency (TF) and Term Frequency - Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF).

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 1.12 - K Nearest Neighbors
videos.description: We introduce the K Nearest Neighbors model in this video. We first understand how this model works. We then learn how to choose the K parameter and use different distance metrics. We also learn how curse of dimensionality affects this model and why feature scaling helps getting better outcomes.

videos.videoTitle: Using Jupyter Notebooks on Sagemaker
videos.description: In this video, we learn how to run Jupyter notebooks on Sagemaker. GitHub repositories: Accelerated NLP,  Accelerated CV, Accelerated TAB

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 2.1 - Tree-based Models
videos.description: We understand the working principles of decision trees in this video. We fit a simple decision tree on a sample dataset. We then introduce the impurity concept with Gini impurity score and explain the split condition selection process. After decision tree discussion, we learn how to build ensemble models using Bagging approach.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 2.2 - Regression Models
videos.description: In this section, we learn two highly popular machine learning models: Linear and Logistic regression. We understand the equations and cost functions of each model.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 2.3 - Optimization
videos.description: In this video, we learn the basics of optimization topic which is key to training many machine learning models. We start with the gradient concept and then introduce gradient descent optimization technique.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 2.4 - Regularization
videos.description: In this video, we learn another key concept in machine learning: Regularization. With regularization we are able to get ML models that can generalize well on test sets. We learn L1, L2 and ElasticNet regularizations and also see the Sklearn interfaces for them.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 2.5 - Hyperparameter Tuning
videos.description: We learn how to find a good combination of hyperparameters using different approaches in this video. We cover grid search, randomized search and bayesian search.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.1 - Neural Networks
videos.description: In this video, we cover one of the most important modern machine learning models: Neural Network. We introduce neural networks using their similarity to the regression models that we learned. We learn the layered structure of neural networks, how data is passed with forward propagation and how training works. Then, we see more details on training process with cost functions and the gradient descent method.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.2 - Word Vectors
videos.description: In this video, we learn how to build embedding vectors for the words in our corpus. We also call these word vectors. With these vectors, we are able to capture semantic similarity between words. We use dot product to measure similarity between word vectors. We then see details of Skip-gram and Continuous Bag of Words (CBOW) methods and build a probabilistic model that gives word vectors.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.3 - Recurrent Neural Networks
videos.description: In this video, we learn a new type of neural network: Recurrent Neural Network (RNN). RNNs are usually used to process sequential data. We learn the overall structure of RNNs and understand how they use internal hidden states to preserve and update sequential information.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.4 - Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs)
videos.description: In this video, we build on the idea of RNNs and introduce a new type of network. Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs) use internal gates to control hidden state updates. We introduce update and forget gates. Reset gate decides how much to remove from the previous hidden state. We also calculate a candidate hidden state. We use the update gate to decide how much we want to include this candidate in the overall hidden state.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.5 - Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) Networks
videos.description: Long Short Term Memory (LSTM) Networks use a similar approach like the Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs). In this video, we learn the internal pieces of LSTMs and understand how they work together to preserve and update sequential information.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.6 - Transformers
videos.description: In this video, we make an introduction to Transformers. We explain the key, value, query concepts using a linguistic approach.

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.7 - Single Headed Attention
videos.description: In this video, we learn how to implement the query, key, value concepts using a neural network approach. We call this method "Single Headed Attention".

videos.videoTitle: Accelerated Natural Language Processing 3.8 - Multi Headed Attention
videos.description: In this video, we introduce Multi Headed Attention concept and conclude Transformers topic. We learn that Multi-headed attention helps to cover a broader range of word meanings. Then, we briefly go over Transformer architecture and give example models.

videos.videoTitle: Source Transformations
videos.description: In this lesson the student will learn how to use source transformations to simplify a circuti.

videos.videoTitle: Frequency Response
videos.description: We will find the transfer function of output voltage divided by input current of a circuit.

videos.videoTitle: Source Transformation | Electric Circuits | Practice Problem 4.6
videos.description: In this video, we will solve a practice problem on source transformation.

videos.videoTitle: Electrical Engineering: Ch 9: 2nd Order Circuits (1 of 76) What is a 2nd Order Circuit?
videos.description: In this video I will explain what are second order circuits- a circuit (series or parallel) that contains a resistor and 2-energy storing devices (capacitors and inductors)

videos.videoTitle: Electrical Engineering: Ch 4: Circuit Theorems (31 of 35) Source Modeling: The Current Source
videos.description: In this video I will explain how the current source is dependent on the Norton resistance and the load resistance.

videos.videoTitle: Gauss Elimination Example 3 | 3x3 Matrix | Numerical Methods
Lagrange Polynomial Interpolation Introduction | Numerical Methods
Gauss central forward & backward difference problems || Gauss central difference
videos.description: This video is about  gauss central difference of forward & backward problems | gauss forward central difference formula | gauss backward central difference formula | numerical analysis |

videos.videoTitle: Euler's Method Differential Equations, Examples, Numerical Methods, Calculus
Newton Raphson Method | Numerical Methods | Formula & Example
Runge-Kutta Method Introduction
Trapezoidal Rule | Numerical Methods | Formula & Example
Simpson's Rule & Numerical Integration
Numerical Methods: Bisection Method
Numerical Methods: False Position Method
Numerical Methods: Newton Raphson Method
Numerical Methods: Secant Method
Gradient of a Vector | Vector Calculus
videos.description: Topics covered under playlist of VECTOR CALCULUS: Gradient of a Vector, Directional Derivative, Divergence, Curl of a Vector, Directional Derivative, Line Integrals, Surface Integrals, Green's Theorem, Gauss Divergence Theorem, Stoke's Theorem.

videos.videoTitle: Directional Derivative, Divergence and Curl of a Vector | Complete Concept | Vector Calculus
videos.description: Topics covered under playlist of VECTOR CALCULUS: Gradient of a Vector, Directional Derivative, Divergence, Curl of a Vector, Directional Derivative, Line Integrals, Surface Integrals, Green's Theorem, Gauss Divergence Theorem, Stoke's Theorem.

videos.description: Introduction to the Laplace Transform

videos.videoTitle: Translation and Inverse Laplace Transforms
videos.description: This is part of my series on the Laplace Transforms in my Differential Equations

videos.videoTitle: Introduction to Operational Amplifier: Characteristics of Ideal Op-Amp
videos.description: In this video, the basic introduction of the Operational Amplifier (Op-Amp) has been given and different characteristics of ideal and real Op-amp (General Purpose 741 Op-Amp) has been discussed.

videos.videoTitle: Operational Amplifier: Inverting Op Amp and The Concept of Virtual Ground in Op Amp
videos.description: In this video, the inverting Op-Amp configuration and the concept of virtual ground in Op-Amp has been discussed.

videos.videoTitle: Operational Amplifier: Non-Inverting Op-Amp and Op-Amp as Buffer (Op-Amp as Voltage Follower)
videos.description: In this video, the non-inverting op-amp configuration and how to use Op-Amp as a buffer or as a voltage follower (Unity Gain Amplifier) has been discussed.

videos.videoTitle: Op-Amp: Summing Amplifier (Inverting and Non-Inverting Summing Amplifiers)
videos.description: In this video, the inverting and the non-inverting summing amplifiers using op-amp has been discussed along with the derivations.

videos.videoTitle: Electromagnetic Waves
videos.description: This physics video tutorial provides a basic introduction into electromagnetic waves.  EM waves are produced by accelerating charged particles and can propagate at the speed of light.  EM waves are composed of changing electric and magnetic fields.

videos.videoTitle: Introduction to Vector Analysis - Vector Analysis - Electromagnetic Engineering
Introduction to Rectangular Coordinate System - Vector Analysis - Electromagnetic Engineering
videos.description: Introduction to Rectangular Coordinate System - Vector Analysis - Electromagnetic Engineering

videos.videoTitle: Rectangular Coordinate System Problem 1 - Vector Analysis - Electromagnetic Field and Wave Theory
How To Solve The Wheatstone Bridge Circuit
videos.description: It explains how to calculate the current in each resistor, the voltage across the resistors, as well as the equivalent resistance of the circuit.  This video also explains how to solve the wheatstone bridge circuit using Kirchoff's current laws.  It also provides formulas that can help you to quickly get the answer.

videos.videoTitle: Data Acquisition Systems | Block Diagram | Part-1/2 | Electrical Instruments ( EIM )
videos.description: Data Acquisition System

videos.videoTitle: Wein bridge circuit - AC bridge
videos.description: Expression to measure frequency and capacitance are explained in great detail

videos.videoTitle: Wheatstone's and Kelvin's bridge | Problems | Electrical Instruments ( EIM )
videos.description: Problems on Wheatstone bridge and kelvin's bridge

videos.videoTitle: Calculating the Missing Resistance in a Wheatstone Bridge
videos.description: Wheatstone Bridge circuits till have a lot of applications. You can measure unknown resistances to a great degree of accuracy. Gas detectors, LDRs, and strain gauges still use them. This is a preliminary video to using a strain gauge in a Wheatstone bridge and then coupling the outputto an instrumentation amplifier.

videos.videoTitle: Calculate Equivalent Resistance of a 5 Resistor Bridge Circuit | Kirchhoff's Loop & Junction Rules
videos.description: This circuit can NOT be reduced using basic series and parallel reductions.  Instead this problem must be solved using loop rule and junction rules.  The physics of this problem is not overly difficult, however the algebra causes most people to get lost in solving the problem.  Here we take a look at  using Ohm's Law to set up a system of equations that can be used to solve for the current and voltage at each resistor as well as the equivalent resistance of the entire circuit.

videos.description: Control Systems: Transfer Function of a Closed Loop and Open Loop Systems
